item.title: How to use C++ in Jupyter Lab
item.description:
How to use C++ in Jupyter Lab

One of the main extension points of the Jupyter stack is the kernel, the part of the infrastructure responsible for executing the userâ€™s code. Jupyter kernels exist for numerous programming languages. Most Jupyter kernels are implemented in the target programming language: the reference implementation ipykernel in Python, IJulia in Julia

Xeus is a C++ implementation of the Jupyter kernel protocol. It is not a kernel itself but a library that facilitates the authoring of kernels, and other applications making use of the Jupyter kernel protocol.
